description.UL:
First of all please check if a JDK is installed by running the command cmd /k java -version from the MS Windows Start\run... menu item as shown below.
A DOS window will popup with the result of your command.
there is no JDK found in the PATH
the JDK (here version: 1.3.102b) was found in the PATH.
Although a JDK is installed on your machine you must check if the "JAVA_HOME" environment variable has been set by running the command cmd /k echo %JAVA_HOME% from the MS Windows Start\run... menu item as described before.
Either the JDK was correctly installed, then the jdk location will appear.
Or, if the string %JAVA_HOME% appears it mean that the environment variable wasn't set.
You will then have to create the JAVA_HOME environment variable from the "my computer" icon properties menu item as shown below. You may have to replace the "c:\java\jdk\" string by the right one !

The last officially supported JDK is the version 1.3.1_06.
